title: Another LLVM build fails on MacOS with clang 8.0.0
body:
LLVM (3.9.0, 3.9.1 and trunk) fails to build  on MacOS with clang 8.0.0:
```sh
[  5%] Building C object projects/compiler-rt/lib/builtins/CMakeFiles/clang_rt.eprintf.dir/eprintf.c.o
cd /private/var/folders/lc/b4bjrtcn69d279m6rf4f42y00000gn/T/jp/spack-stage/spack-stage-k6HyYw/llvm-3.9.1.src/spack-build/projects/compiler-rt/lib/builtins && /Users/jp/Programs/GitHub/Spack/spack/lib/spack/env/clang/clang  -D__STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS -D__STDC_FORMAT_MACROS -D__STDC_LIMIT_MACROS -I/private/var/folders/lc/b4bjrtcn69d279m6rf4f42y00000gn/T/jp/spack-stage/spack-stage-k6HyYw/llvm-3.9.1.src/spack-build/projects/compiler-rt/lib/builtins -I/private/var/folders/lc/b4bjrtcn69d279m6rf4f42y00000gn/T/jp/spack-stage/spack-stage-k6HyYw/llvm-3.9.1.src/projects/compiler-rt/lib/builtins -I/private/var/folders/lc/b4bjrtcn69d279m6rf4f42y00000gn/T/jp/spack-stage/spack-stage-k6HyYw/llvm-3.9.1.src/spack-build/include -I/private/var/folders/lc/b4bjrtcn69d279m6rf4f42y00000gn/T/jp/spack-stage/spack-stage-k6HyYw/llvm-3.9.1.src/include  -O3 -DNDEBUG -arch i386    -isysroot -mmacosx-version-min=10.5 -arch i386 -fPIC -O3 -fvisibility=hidden -DVISIBILITY_HIDDEN -Wall -fomit-frame-pointer -o CMakeFiles/clang_rt.eprintf.dir/eprintf.c.o   -c /private/var/folders/lc/b4bjrtcn69d279m6rf4f42y00000gn/T/jp/spack-stage/spack-stage-k6HyYw/llvm-3.9.1.src/projects/compiler-rt/lib/builtins/eprintf.c
clang: warning: no such sysroot directory: '-mmacosx-version-min=10.5'
/private/var/folders/lc/b4bjrtcn69d279m6rf4f42y00000gn/T/jp/spack-stage/spack-stage-k6HyYw/llvm-3.9.1.src/projects/compiler-rt/lib/builtins/eprintf.c:14:10: fatal error: 'stdio.h' file not found
#include <stdio.h>
         ^
1 error generated.
make[2]: *** [projects/compiler-rt/lib/builtins/CMakeFiles/clang_rt.eprintf.dir/eprintf.c.o] Error 1
```

~~Sadly this issue is not limited to `spack`, e.g.  see [here](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/issues/6492), [here](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/issues/3030), and [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39438048/clang-warning-no-such-sysroot-directory-mmacosx-version-min-10-5-on-compil). What is puzzling me is that `compiler-rt`, which seems to be the offending subpackage, is built even if I tell `spack` not to do so. This is in my packages.yaml:~~
```
  llvm: # compiler-rt fails with a commonly reported error about stdio.h, due to a bogus parameter being passed as a setting
    version: [3.9.1]
    variants: +all_targets+clang~compiler-rt~debug+gold+internal_unwind+libcxx~link_dylib+lldb+polly~shared_libs
```
and the output of
